intro: Acineta schilleriana, commonly known as the Schiller's acineta, is a small, flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
